Hello Wesley,

Thanks for your response. I'm doing it for fun interest and =
personal profit if 
it works, I'm more fascinated by the prospect both Astr=
o and AI working 
together. 


The Swiss Astro Engine is freely available a=
nd can generate planetary 
information in real time. I would initially star=
t with daily price data then 
scale it up to Monthly or Hours and minutes. =



The inputs is going to be the planetary locations together with the clos=
e prices 
of target data. 


I have all the data available in excel format,=
 what the best and quickest way to 
carry out some tests?


Peter   




__=
______________________________
From: Wesley Tansey <tansey@...>
To: neat=
@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wed, 3 November, 2010 1:01:02
Subject: Re: [neat] Fi=
ancial trading with Hyperneat

   
Hi Peter,

Maybe you could fill us in a =
little more. For starters, what's an Astro Engine? 
What kind of intervals =
are you trading? What are the     inputs/outputs going to 
be? What is your=
 data set size? How are you     going to prevent over-fitting?

1. I think =
it's impossible to say without knowing more.
2. Not theoretically. I suppos=
e at some point, your net gets too     slow to be 
practical.
3. The EPlex =
C++ framework: 
http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/software.html#gaucij_HyperNEAT
Also=
, Colin Green's SharpNEAT (C#) framework: 
https://sites.google.com/site/sh=
arpneat/

Also, are you doing this for fun or profit? If you're doing it fo=
r     profit, 
there are a ton of other considerations that you have to    =
 take into account, 
particularly regarding trading costs and     regulatio=
ns.

Wesley

On 11/2/2010 8:47 PM, Peter Henry wrote: 
  
>Hello, 
>
>I wou=
ld like to create trading indicator and systems                 using 
>Hyp=
erNEAT, input data is going to be fed from an Astro Engine, up-to 30 inputs=
 
>required and one output. 
>
>
>Can someone please answer the following q=
uestions or                 simply give 
>there options 
>
>
>1, Does anyon=
e think the HyperNEAT is suitable for such                 a task
>2, Is th=
ere any restrictions on the amount of input data                 that 
>can=
 be used. 
>
>3, What is the best HyperNEAT Software Libraries             =
    available
>
>The engine is going to be used for forecast forex prices  =
               using 
>Astro and Inter-market data. HyperNeat to be used   =
              to work out 
>relationships and predict prices,
>
>Thanks in =
advance I will share any results with group 
>
>Peter 
>
>
